alert.note: Alert for Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Chaffee County above 9000Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:13PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Chaffee and northwestern Fremont Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 211 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Salida, or 12 miles north of Decker Burn Scar, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. CoCorahs report of pea size hail to the north of Salida. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Chaffee and northwestern Fremont Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
